ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The milestone assignments were somewhat helpful for keeping me on track and formulating a conceptual structure of my essay.
This was only the first half of the year-long course, but all the skills I learned were about researching, finding secondary sources, writing a little bit, trying to figure out a topic.

I learned how to write an annotated bibliography, and I became more experienced with working with primary and secondary historical sources. I made progress on my history senior essay, which I plan to complete in the spring
Significantly improved my archival research and analysis skills.
I'm learning how to engage in long-term research. This has been a very rewarding process as I've narrowed down my topic.
Research

On Mellon and History Department funds, I went to the LIbrary of Congress to conduct archival research. I found sources that filled the gaps in the project I had designed and questions that I had asked.
writing a thesis
It's been fun so far!
Independent history research
Making personal goals and sticking to them. I also learned how to use Yale's archival services.
During the senior thesis project I better developed my abilities to track down sources and hone my own ideas on historical issues.
I've learned a lot about my thesis topic and about working on a long-term research project.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: If there was more interactive time, perhaps the sort of senior seminar seen in other departments, I would have been more engaged.

I would have appreciated a little more engagement from my advisor, especially with choosing a topic and finding quality primary sources. Also, I felt like some of the assignments like the 3-page primary source analysis were a bit silly, although I liked the prospectus and the annotated bibliography. I also would have liked to get more feedback from my advisor, especially on my ten page draft.

Strengths:
- multiple deadlines throughout the semester keep you on track in terms of senior essay progresss

Weaknesses:
- notification of upcoming deadlines could have been clearer, since I was caught off guard by a couple of them at the beginning of the semester
Course offers a close dive into a topic of particular interest, and it's a unique experience unlike anything else at Yale. It feels largely self-directed, which can be both a strength and a weakness.
Professor Magaziner has been extremely helpful in guiding me through the research process. No suggestions for improvements.
Gitlin is an amazing advisor and it was helpful to meet with him once a week to discuss my progress and set goals for the next week.

Choosing a topic and advisor was the most difficult part of this semester. Other than that, everything flowed smoothly. My advisor and I have a good working relationship, and he is intellectually rigorous yet respectful of undergraduates and our academic development at this juncture of our academic careers.
Make the deadlines later, the prospectus was due way too early
it's pretty great
I didn't feel like I got much direction or feedback from my essay advisor during this semester.
Strengths were my advisor and the milestones to keep us on track. It would be cool if we could collaborate with other History majors though.

It really all depends on your advisor and your passion for your chosen topic. I think the course could be improved through greater opportunities to interact and work with fellow senior history majors.

I have loved working on my thesis! I sometimes found the department-wide deadlines arbitrary or not aligned with where I was on my project. However, I understand that they're helpful to some in approaching a project of this size.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This question doesn't really make sense since you'll take this course if you have to and won't if you don't! I do think year round is a much better experience than one semester, which ends up being basically an elongated term paper.
Yes, better to do a 2 semester senior essay than a 1 semester because it allows you more time to delve into the topic in greater detail
Yes.
It's required for history majors.
it's the thesis, you kind of have to
Mandatory for history majors, but I think it is a worthwhile exercise.
Yes.
